intro: Achyrospermum squamosum, commonly known as the velvetleaf or velvetleaf morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Convolvulaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, velvety leaves and trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with hairy stems and alternate leaves.
